Posts.Content: Hi, i think a research project would be a good idea and would be happy to participate.  i would be more than happy to discuss the good and bad points of having a PICC line as i feel there are a few points that could be worked on to make having a line more comfortable. Thanks too for your words on Docetaxel, i have taken it all on board. take care anna
Posts.Title: central lines and herceptin

Posts.Content: Hi, i had a picc line put in after just 1 dose of chemo. i think it makes sense, not sure why they didnt do it earlier for you if you were having problems? I must admit i am not a fan of needles, but for me the whole procedure only took about an hour.  I am looking forward to getting rid of it, 4 more cycles to go.
Posts.Title: central lines and herceptin

Posts.Content: I didnt know about portacaths until after i had my PICC line in. I totally agree having a line in makes sense, especially hearing about the problems other people are having with their veins. I think my main gripe about PICC lines is that the district nurse team on initial visit didnt seem overly confident with them. I think that adds to an already anxious time. Also i think that i certainly didnt realise just how inconvenient in every day living they would be. Although i will admit,  its worth it to keep some veins. anna
Posts.Title: central lines and herceptin

Posts.Content: thanks sue, i think i am a bit neurotic these days. I will ring up tomorrow and see what the nurse says. Im sure it would have showed up on the scan if it was anything nasty. thanks anna
Posts.Title: rib pain

Posts.Content: hi, can i please ask if anyone else has had rib pain? i was getting it before i was diagnosed and have since had a bone scan which was clear. It doesnt appear to be getting any better though. thanks anna
Posts.Title: rib pain

Posts.Content: It is difficult to know what you should and shouldnt worry about, and i guess i should make use of the breast care nurse. I have only spoken to her once since i started treament so i guess she wont mind. thanks again you are a huge help anna x
Posts.Title: rib pain

Posts.Content: Hi, touch wood mine hasnt been too bad, but i do remember somewhere, someone saying aqueous cream was helpful if it got sore and dry. I havent needed it yet so cant tell you if it works but just so you werent left with no answer. I dont know if anyone else has any better suggestions? take care anna
Posts.Title: hair lost

Posts.Content: I have a PICC line and i hate it. I think on top of everything else it is one more thing to worry about. I long to be able to just relax and soak in the bath. I can see the convenience of it though as when getting treatment there are no problems finding veins, and so it makes sense. I think the major concern for me though is that the district nurse hasnt had a lot of dealings with them, and again this worries me. I am keeping it whilst i need it but as soon as i dont its coming out.
Posts.Title: Portacath

Posts.Content: Hi, i am currently having chemo and due to have mastectomy in january. I am hoping to go for the deip i think its called as i was wanting to be able to get back to as normal training as possible. I was concerned about leaving muscles where they were supposed to be. I am currently waiting for appt to see surgeon so i will see what she says. good luck anna
Posts.Title: Help! Can't decide on what reconstruction to have.
